section.hand:
To my L Tresuro
r
N
o
24. 89

page.lettertext:
Belgia 1589 24 Novem
b
To my Lord Treasurer
It may please yo
r
L. this bearer
Mons
r
Lect
being sent
unto hir
Ma
ty
by the city of
Geneva
to declare
e lamentable
state wh
r
too they be reduced, & to receave some convenient
relieffe hath bin driven into these Provinces by
contrairety of winde &
e opportunity
s
ving hath delt
w
th
e
generall States
, unto whom also hee hath letters
of request for theyr charitable ayde. Theyr answere
unto him hath bin very favourable er that they
[.]
promise w
th
out delay to write very earnestly
unto theyr Provinces & Townes & they to
cure a
g
nal
contribution & [ceasement] or some private collection
by waie of benevolence seeming to bee moved w
th
more
compassion
en most men expected, & because to attend
the [retourne] of [aunswer] from theyr Principals & then
after
e collection of that w
ch
will happely bee
graunted doth require a great deale of time, w
ch
[the]
quality of his message may by no meanes affourd
he is advised by them to leave a sollicto
r
behinde
& himself to de
te for
Englande,
w
ch
being th'effect
of
t
he hath negotiated heer, I thought yt my
duty to acquaint yo
r
L. w
th
it
& so take my
humble leave. N
o
24. 89
